title: Stormzy TIME cover revealed as rapper says he's overwhelmed
text:
Yes Stormzy! (Picture: Getty, TIME)

Stormzy gave an emotional speech about the pressures that come with fame as he announced that he was going to be on the cover of TIME Magazine.

The 26-year-old rapper is the latest cover star for the historic American weekly news publication, being interviewed by Why I’m No Longer Talking To White People About Race author Reni Eddo-Lodge as part of their Next Generation Leaders issue.

This overseas acknowledgement is one in a long line of recent milestones for 26-year-old Stormzy (we’re still thinking about that incredible Glastonbury headline performance), who penned a heartfelt message as he shared the cover on Instagram.

‘One of my absolute proudest moments,’ Stormzy, whose real name is Michael Omari, wrote. ‘I can’t even comprehend this. I am on the cover of TIME.’

He continued: ‘I’ve stared at this cover for a few minutes and it feels like one of those “how the f***kkkk did man get here?!” moments. God’s favour and the ever lasting love and support you guys show me has elevated me to a place in life where this South London kid is worthy enough to grace the cover of the most prestigious publication in the World.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

Thanking TIME and God for the ‘huge honour’ of being named a Next Generation Leader, the Vossi Bop rapper continued: ‘Anyone who knows me knows how much I shy away from being anything other than “Mike”.

The British rapper is making waves abroad (Picture: TIME)

‘The thought of being a “role model” or “leader” or whatever it is can often feel way way way too heavy and too overwhelming and a lot of the time […] I can’t even bare the weight of being myself let alone any of these other titles.’

Stormzy added: ‘I am deeply flawed and still learning how to be a man and still figuring out how to grow into the person I need to be but within all of that confusion and all the juggling of being a human and trying to be a superhuman – I have purpose. And my purpose has lead me here. Big Mike for TIME ya na.’

Oh god, is anyone else emotional?

description: Stormzy gave an emotional speech about the pressures that come with fame as he announced that he was going to TIME Magazine's latest coverstar.
